task_summary: Robot arm is tasked to pick up the red object from the table. The sequence includes perceiving, approaching, grasping, verifying grasp, and lifting the object.

task_long_description.overview: This task involves a robotic manipulator picking up a red, cylindrical object from a table surface marked with several blue squares, as shown in frames [0]-[8]. The robot moves from perception to approach, aligns above the object, lowers to make contact, closes the gripper to grasp, verifies the grasp is stable, and lifts the object above the table. The table and red object are the only objects involved; precise alignment and gentle grasping are implied. The robot uses visual and contact feedback for reliability.
preconditions: Red object is present and visible on the table
Robot is at home or neutral position
stepwise_plan: Ensure red object is visible, re-scan if necessary
Detect red object with visual sensor
Approach and align gripper with object
Lower until gentle contact is detected
Close gripper with sufficient force to grasp
Lift object slightly above the table
success_criteria: Red object securely held by gripper
failure_and_recovery: If object not visible, re-scan area up to 3 times
If grasp fails, repeat alignment and grasp
If contact or force threshold not met, try slow lowering again
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when object is held in gripper and lifted above the table surface

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object can be seen by sensors.
Scans the table area for the red object using a grid pattern.
Detects and localizes the red object on the table.
Opens the gripper to receive the object.
Moves gripper above the red object.
Aligns the gripper precisely with the object.
Lowers gripper until light contact with the object.
Closes gripper to grasp the object.
Verifies the object is successfully grasped.
Raises the gripped object above the table surface.

failure_modes: Gripper fails to close or grasp securely
recovery_strategy: Lower at slow speed if contact fails
assumptions: Red object is cylindrical and distinct from blue markers
Frames show one uninterrupted pick sequence
Instruction does not specify target pose after pick, so 'pick up only' is performed
All actions are supported by the hardware

expected_success_criteria: Red object firmly grasped and lifted above table
